intro: Helleborine ovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive three-lobed lip, which are typically arranged in a loose raceme. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Helleborine ovata is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
